<!-- source-hash: 5cd7fb6117e71f4e401f1bf248cab692 -->
A DTO (Data Transfer Object) class representing the complete response structure for integrated tools in the OpenFrame system, including metadata, URLs, credentials, and categorization information.

## Key Components

- **Core Fields**: `id`, `name`, `description`, `icon` for basic tool identification
- **URL Management**: `toolUrls` list containing associated tool endpoints
- **Classification**: `type`, `toolType`, `category`, `platformCategory` for organization
- **State**: `enabled` boolean flag for tool availability
- **Security**: `credentials` object for authentication details

## Usage Example

```java
// Building a tool response
ToolResponse response = ToolResponse.builder()
    .id("tool-123")
    .name("tactical-rmm")
    .description("Remote monitoring and management tool")
    .icon("tactical-rmm-icon")
    .type("rmm")
    .toolType("monitoring")
    .category("monitoring")
    .platformCategory("web")
    .enabled(true)
    .toolUrls(Arrays.asList(urlResponse1, urlResponse2))
    .credentials(credentialsResponse)
    .build();

// Accessing tool information
String toolName = response.getName();
boolean isEnabled = response.getEnabled();
List<ToolUrlResponse> urls = response.getToolUrls();
```

The class uses Lombok annotations for automatic generation of getters, setters, constructors, and builder pattern. Swagger annotations provide API documentation with examples and descriptions for each field.
